record.title: CHILDREN'S HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM REAUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2007
record.narrative:
CHILDREN'S HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM REAUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2007 -- (Senate - September 26, 2007)

[Page: S12122]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask the Chair lay before the Senate the message from the House to accompany H.R. 976, the children's health insurance bill.

record.narrative: There being no objection, the Presiding Officer laid before the Senate the following message from the House of Representatives:

Resolved, That the House agree to the amendments of the Senate to the bill (H.R. 976) "an Act to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1968 to provide tax relief for small businesses, and for other purposes," with amendments.

speaking.paragraph: I move to concur with the House amendment, and I send a cloture motion to the desk.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, do hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to concur in the House amendments to the Senate amendments to H.R. 976, SCHIP.

speaking.paragraph: I ask the mandatory quorum call under rule XXII be waived.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I move to concur in the first House amendment, with the amendment that is at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. REID] proposes an amendment numbered 3071 to the House amendment to the text of H.R. 976.
At the end of the amendment add the following:
This section shall take effect 3 days after date of enactment.

speaking.paragraph: I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: Is there a sufficient second? There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I ask now that the clerk report the second-degree amendment which is at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 3072 to amendment No. 3071.
In the amendment strike 3 and insert 1.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I think I interrupted my distinguished friend. Did he have more business to conduct?
